sentences.sContent: a deer dazzled by the headlights
sentences.sCn: 被车头灯光照得目眩的鹿

sentences.sContent: As children, we were dazzled by my uncle’s good looks and charm.
sentences.sCn: 小时候，我叔叔的英俊外表和魅力令我们倾倒。

exam.question: Put on dark glasses or the sun will ______ you and you won’t be able to see.

answer.explain: 句意： 戴上墨镜， 否则阳光会令你目眩， 看不见东西。discern： 目睹， 认识； distort： 扭曲， 歪曲； distract： 转移。

words.tran: 头昏眼花地；恍惚地；眼花缭乱地

trans.tranOther: if a very bright light dazzles you, it stops you from seeing properly for a short time
